name: Variable Name
title: Variable Label (ie Title)
encodings: List of Variable Value Encodings (i.e., mappings; value labels)

name: The name of a variable (i.e., field) as it appears in the data.
title: The human-readable title of the variable.
description: An extended description of the variable.
type: A classification allowing the user (analyst, researcher or computer) to know how to use the variable
format: Indicates the format of the type specified in the `type` property. This may describe the type of unit (such as for time fields like year or month) or the format of a date field (such as %y%m%d).
constraints.maxLength: Indicates the maximum length of an iterable (e.g., array, string, or object). For example, if 'Hello World' is the longest value of a categorical variable, this would be a maxLength of 11.
constraints.enum: Constrains possible values to a set of values.
constraints.pattern: A regular expression pattern the data MUST conform to.
constraints.maximum: Specifies the maximum value of a field (e.g., maximum -- or most recent -- date, maximum integer etc). Note, this is different then maxLength property.
encodings: Encodings (and mappings) allow categorical values to be stored as numerical values. Many analytic software programs use numerical encodings and some algorithms only support numerical values. Additionally, this field provides a way to store categoricals that are stored as  "short" labels (such as abbreviations)
ordered: Indicates whether a categorical variable is ordered. This variable  is relevant for variables that have an ordered relationship but not necessarily  a numerical relationship (e.g., Strongly disagree < Disagree < Neutral < Agree).
missingValues: A list of missing values specific to a variable.
trueValues: For boolean (true) variable (as defined in type field), this field allows a physical string representation to be cast as true (increasing readability of the field)
falseValues: For boolean (false) variable (as defined in type field), this field allows a physical string representation to be cast as false (increasing readability of the field)
repo_link: A link to the variable as it exists on the home repository, if applicable

name: cool_var
title: Cool Variable
description: This is the description of a really cool variable
